channel.title: CVE Feed for Blender -- Blender
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Blender -- Blender

item.title: CVE-2017-2903|2024-09-16T18:12:45.760Z -- blender -- blender
item.description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the DPX loading functionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite version 2.78c. A specially crafted '.cin' file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to use the file as an asset via the sequencer in order to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-12086|2024-09-16T18:59:05.378Z -- blender -- blender
item.description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the 'BKE_mesh_calc_normals_tessface' functionality of the Blender open-source 3d creation suite. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to open a .blend file in order to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-12102|2024-09-16T16:54:15.396Z -- blender -- blender
item.description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the way that the Blender open-source 3d creation suite v2.78c converts curves to polygons. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to open the file or use the file as a library in order to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-12103|2024-09-16T17:48:11.347Z -- blender -- blender
item.description: An exploitable integer overflow exists in the way that the Blender open-source 3d creation suite v2.78c converts text rendered as a font into a curve. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integer overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code execution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user to open the file or use the file as a library in order to trigger this vulnerability.
